news_summary: A heartwarming story highlights the successful integration of a dog into a family of cats, showcasing harmony across species. Meanwhile, new insights reveal that complex knots may be easier to untie than simpler ones, offering fresh understanding in everyday problem-solving. Additionally, China's journal ranking system has been validated, reinforcing the credibility of its academic evaluation methods.
news_summary_fr: Une histoire réconfortante met en lumière l'intégration réussie d'un chien dans une famille de chats, illustrant l'harmonie entre les espèces. Par ailleurs, de nouvelles connaissances révèlent que les nœuds complexes peuvent être plus faciles à défaire que les nœuds plus simples, ce qui permet de mieux comprendre la résolution des problèmes quotidiens. En outre, le système de classement des revues chinoises a été validé, ce qui renforce la crédibilité de ses méthodes d'évaluation universitaire.
news_summary_es: Una conmovedora historia destaca la integración de un perro en una familia de gatos, mostrando la armonía entre especies. Por otra parte, nuevos conocimientos revelan que los nudos complejos pueden ser más fáciles de desatar que los simples, lo que ofrece una nueva perspectiva para la resolución de problemas cotidianos. Además, se ha validado el sistema chino de clasificación de revistas, lo que refuerza la credibilidad de sus métodos de evaluación académica.

articles.title: A canine friend to a feline family

articles.reasoning: The story highlights an unlikely friendship between a dog and a cat with her kittens, which is a heartwarming example of kindness and companionship across species. While it does not involve major scientific breakthroughs or large-scale impact, it reflects positive themes of friendship and harmony in nature.
articles.personality_title: A dog and a cat become unexpected friends
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
In a world where animals often stick to their own kind, stories of unlikely friendships warm our hearts.

**What happened**
A dog has formed a sweet bond with a cat and her kittens, showing kindness and companionship across species.

**Impact**
This touching friendship reminds us that connection and harmony can happen anywhere, even between very different animals.

**What's next step**
We hope to see more stories like this that inspire people to appreciate the gentle side of nature.

**One-sentence takeaway**
Sometimes, friendship can surprise us, bringing together the most unlikely pals in the most wonderful ways.
articles.personality_title_fr: Un chien et un chat deviennent des amis inattendus
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Context**
Dans un monde où les animaux s'en tiennent souvent à leur propre espèce, des histoires d'amitiés improbables réchauffent notre cœur.

**ce qui s'est passé**
Un chien a formé un lien sucré avec un chat et ses chatons, montrant la gentillesse et la compagnie entre les espèces.

**Impact**
Cette amitié touchante nous rappelle que la connexion et l'harmonie peuvent se produire n'importe où, même entre des animaux très différents.

**Quelle est la prochaine étape**
Nous espérons voir plus d'histoires comme celle-ci qui incitent les gens à apprécier le côté doux de la nature.

**à emporter à une phrase**
Parfois, l'amitié peut nous surprendre, réunissant les copains les plus improbables de la manière la plus merveilleuse.
articles.personality_title_es: Un perro y un gato se convierten en amigos inesperados
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**contexto**
En un mundo donde los animales a menudo se adhieren a su propio tipo, historias de amistades poco probables calientan nuestros corazones.

**Qué pasó**
Un perro ha formado un vínculo dulce con un gato y sus gatitos, mostrando amabilidad y compañía entre especies.

**Impacto**
Esta amistad conmovedora nos recuerda que la conexión y la armonía pueden ocurrir en cualquier lugar, incluso entre animales muy diferentes.

**¿Qué es el siguiente paso**?
Esperamos ver más historias como esta que inspire a las personas a apreciar el lado suave de la naturaleza.

**Control de una oración**
A veces, la amistad puede sorprendernos, reuniendo a los amigos más improbables de las maneras más maravillosas.

articles.title: Complex knots can actually be easier to untie than simple ones
articles.summary: Mathematicians have solved a decades-old problem in knot theory, discovering that linking two knots together can actually produce a knot that is easier to untie – the opposite of what was expected
articles.content:
Mathematicians have solved a decades-old problem in knot theory, discovering that linking two knots together can actually produce a knot that is easier to untie – the opposite of what was expected

A knotty problem for mathematicians finally has a solution Pinkybird/Getty Images

Why is untangling two small knots more difficult than unravelling one big one? Surprisingly, mathematicians have found that larger and seemingly more complex knots created by joining two simpler ones together can sometimes be easier to undo, invalidating a conjecture posed almost 90 years ago.

“We were looking for a counterexample without really having an expectation of finding one, because this conjecture had been around so long,” says Mark Brittenham at the University of Nebraska at Lincoln. “In the back of our heads, we were thinking that the conjecture was likely to be true. It was very unexpected and very surprising. “

Mathematicians like Brittenham study knots by treating them as tangled loops with joined ends. One of the most important concepts in knot theory is that each knot has an unknotting number, which is the number of times you would have to sever the string, move another piece of the loop through the gap and then re-join the ends before you reached a circle with no crossings at all – known as the “unknot”.

Calculating unknotting numbers can be a very computationally intensive task, and there are still knots with as few as 10 crossings that have no solution. Because of this, it can be helpful to break knots down into two or more simpler knots to analyse them, with those that can’t be split any further known as prime knots, analogous to prime numbers.

But a long-standing mystery is whether the unknotting numbers of the two knots added together would give you the unknotting number of the larger knot. Intuitively, it might make sense that a combined knot would be at least as hard to undo as the sum of its constituent parts, and in 1937, it was conjectured that undoing the combined knot could never be easier.

Free newsletter Sign up to The Daily The latest on what’s new in science and why it matters each day. Sign up to newsletter

Now, Brittenham and Susan Hermiller, also at the University of Nebraska at Lincoln, have shown that there are cases when this isn’t true. “The conjecture’s been around for 88 years and as people continue not to find anything wrong with it, people get more hopeful that it’s true,” says Hermiller. “First, we found one, and then quickly we found infinitely many pairs of knots for whom the connected sum had unknotting numbers that were strictly less than the sum of the unknotting numbers of the two pieces.”

“We’ve shown that we don’t understand unknotting numbers nearly as well as we thought we did,” says Brittenham. “There could be – even for knots that aren’t connected sums – more efficient ways than we ever imagined for unknotting them. Our hope is that this has really opened up a new door for researchers to start exploring.”

An example of a knot that is easier to undo than its constituent parts Mark Brittenham, Susan Hermiller

While finding and checking the counterexamples involved a combination of existing knowledge, intuition and computing power, the final stage of checking the proof was done in a decidedly more simple and practical manner: tying the knot with a piece of rope and physically untangling it to show that the researchers’ predicted unknotting number was correct.

Andras Juhasz at the University of Oxford, who previously worked with AI company DeepMind to prove a different conjecture in knot theory, says that he and the company had tried unsuccessfully to crack this latest problem about additive sets in the same way, but with no luck.

“We spent at least a year or two trying to find a counterexample and without success, so we gave up,” says Juhasz. “It is possible that for finding counterexamples that are like a needle in a haystack, AI is maybe not the best tool. This was a hard-to-find counterexample, I believe, because we searched pretty hard.”

Despite there being many practical applications for knot theory, from cryptography to molecular biology, Nicholas Jackson at the University of Warwick, UK, is hesitant to suggest that this new result can be put to good use. “I guess we now understand a little bit more about how circles work in three dimensions than we did before,” he says. “A thing that we didn’t understand quite so well a couple of months ago is now understood slightly better.”
articles.reasoning: This news reports a significant scientific breakthrough in mathematics, solving a decades-old problem in knot theory. Such advances expand human knowledge and open new avenues for research, which is inherently positive and hopeful. While it may not have immediate practical applications, the discovery challenges existing assumptions and inspires further exploration.
articles.personality_title: Scientists discover bigger knots can be easier to untie
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
Mathematicians have long studied knots, trying to understand their twists and turns. For years, they wondered if tying two knots together would always make things harder to untangle.

**What happened**
Recently, they solved this puzzle by showing that linking two knots can actually create a new knot that’s easier to undo than the originals. This was the opposite of what everyone expected.

**Impact**
This discovery changes how we think about knots and could inspire new ideas in math and science. It reminds us that sometimes bigger or more complex doesn’t mean more difficult.

**What’s next step**
Researchers will explore how this finding fits into other areas of mathematics and possibly real-world problems, opening doors to more surprising insights.

**One-sentence takeaway**
Sometimes, tying two knots together can make untying them simpler—a twist that surprises and inspires.
articles.personality_title_fr: Les scientifiques découvrent que les nœuds plus gros peuvent être plus faciles à dénigrer
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Context**
Les mathématiciens ont longtemps étudié les nœuds, essayant de comprendre leurs rebondissements. Pendant des années, ils se demandaient si deux nœuds ensemble rendraient toujours les choses plus difficiles à démêler.

**ce qui s'est passé**
Récemment, ils ont résolu ce puzzle en montrant que la liaison de deux nœuds peut en fait créer un nouveau nœud plus facile à défaire que les originaux. C'était l'opposé de ce que tout le monde s'attendait.

**Impact**
Cette découverte change la façon dont nous pensons aux nœuds et pourrait inspirer de nouvelles idées en mathématiques et en sciences. Cela nous rappelle que parfois plus grand ou plus complexe ne signifie pas plus difficile.

**Quelle est la prochaine étape**
Les chercheurs exploreront comment cette constatation s'inscrit dans d'autres domaines de mathématiques et éventuellement des problèmes réels, ouvrant les portes à des informations plus surprenantes.

**à emporter à une phrase**
Parfois, attacher deux nœuds ensemble peut les rendre plus simples - une touche qui surprend et inspire.
articles.personality_title_es: Los científicos descubren que los nudos más grandes pueden ser más fácil de desanimar
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**contexto**
Los matemáticos han estudiado nudos durante mucho tiempo, tratando de entender sus giros y vueltas. Durante años, se preguntaron si atar dos nudos siempre dificultaría el desenredado.

**Qué pasó**
Recientemente, resolvieron este rompecabezas al mostrar que vincular dos nudos puede crear un nuevo nudo que sea más fácil de deshacer que los originales. Esto fue lo contrario de lo que todos esperaban.

**Impacto**
Este descubrimiento cambia la forma en que pensamos sobre los nudos y podríamos inspirar nuevas ideas en matemáticas y ciencias. Nos recuerda que a veces más grande o más complejo no significa más difícil.

**¿Qué es el siguiente paso**?
Los investigadores explorarán cómo este hallazgo encaja en otras áreas de las matemáticas y posiblemente problemas del mundo real, abriendo puertas a ideas más sorprendentes.

**Control de una oración**
A veces, unir dos nudos puede simplificarlos, un giro que sorprende e inspira.

articles.reasoning: The article indicates that China's journal ranking system has been validated and stands up to scrutiny, which suggests improvement in academic standards and transparency. This can foster trust in scientific publishing and encourage scholarly communication, which is a positive development in education and research.
articles.personality_title: China’s journal ranking system earns trust after careful review
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
China has a system for ranking scientific journals that helps researchers decide where to publish their work.

**What happened**
Recently, experts took a close look at this system and found that it stands up to careful examination.

**Impact**
This means the system is reliable and trustworthy, which is great news for scientists and educators in China and beyond.

**What's next step**
With confidence in the ranking system, more researchers can share their discoveries openly, boosting knowledge and collaboration.

**One-sentence takeaway**
China’s validated journal ranking system is a strong step forward for science and education.
articles.personality_title_fr: Le système de classement des journaux chinois gagne la confiance après un examen minutieux
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Context**
La Chine a un système de classement des revues scientifiques qui aident les chercheurs à décider où publier leur travail.

**ce qui s'est passé**
Récemment, les experts ont examiné de près ce système et ont constaté qu'il résiste à un examen minutieux.

**Impact**
Cela signifie que le système est fiable et digne de confiance, ce qui est une excellente nouvelle pour les scientifiques et les éducateurs en Chine et au-delà.

**Quelle est la prochaine étape**
Avec confiance dans le système de classement, de plus en plus de chercheurs peuvent partager leurs découvertes ouvertement, stimulant les connaissances et la collaboration.

**à emporter à une phrase**
Le système de classement des revues validé en Chine est un fort pas en avant pour la science et l'éducation.
articles.personality_title_es: El sistema de clasificación de diario de China gana confianza después de una revisión cuidadosa
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**contexto**
China tiene un sistema para clasificar las revistas científicas que ayuda a los investigadores a decidir dónde publicar su trabajo.

**Qué pasó**
Recientemente, los expertos echaron un vistazo a este sistema y descubrieron que se destaca para un examen cuidadoso.

**Impacto**
Esto significa que el sistema es confiable y confiable, lo cual es una gran noticia para los científicos y educadores en China y más allá.

**¿Qué es el siguiente paso**?
Con confianza en el sistema de clasificación, más investigadores pueden compartir sus descubrimientos abiertamente, lo que aumenta el conocimiento y la colaboración.

**Control de una oración**
El sistema de clasificación de revistas validado de China es un fuerte paso adelante para la ciencia y la educación.
